eu.smartdatalake.simsearch

Class Assistant

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.Assistant

  • public class Assistant
extends Object
    Auxiliary class that provides various helper methods.

      • Assistant

        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • decodeOperation

        public String decodeOperation(int op)
        Provides the textual description of the type of operation with the given number.
        Parameters:
        op - The numeric identifier of the requested operation (e.g., 0: CATEGORICAL_TOPK; 1:SPATIAL_KNN ; 2:NUMERICAL_TOPK).
        Returns:
        A string describing the type of the operation.

      • getColumnNumber

        public int getColumnNumber(String inputFile,
                           String colName,
                           String columnDelimiter)
        Identifies which column in the header of the input CSV file corresponds to the given attribute name.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - The input CSV file.
        colName - The attribute name.
        columnDelimiter - The delimiter character in the CSV file.
        Returns:
        A positive integer representing the ordinal number of the column in the file; -1, if this attribute name is not found in the header.

      • arrayJSON2String

        public String[] arrayJSON2String(org.json.simple.JSONArray jsonArray)
        Converts a JSONArray object into an array of strings.
        Parameters:
        jsonArray - Input JSON array.
        Returns:
        Output array of string values.

      • arrayJSON2Double

        public Double[] arrayJSON2Double(org.json.simple.JSONArray jsonArray)
        Provides an array of double numbers as consumed from a JSON array of values.
        Parameters:
        jsonArray - A JSON array of values.
        Returns:
        Output array of double values.

      • formatAttrValue

        public Object formatAttrValue(Object val)
        Formats attribute values to be issued in the reporting results.
        Parameters:
        val - The attribute value (numerical, textual, spatial) to be formatted.
        Returns:
        The formatted attribute value.

      • formatDateValue

        public String formatDateValue(Object epoch)
        Formats date/time values to be issued in the reporting results.
        Parameters:
        epoch - The attribute value expressed as a double number (epoch).
        Returns:
        The formatted date/time.

      • formatURL

        public String formatURL(String prefixURL,
                        String id)
        Format entity identifiers as URL for the final results
        Parameters:
        prefixURL - The HTTP prefix to be used.
        id - The identifier of the entity
        Returns:
        A resolvable URL to be used as entity identifier for a similarity search result.

      • tokenize

        public TokenSet tokenize(String id,
                         String keywords,
                         String tokDelimiter)
        Tokenizes the given string of keywords using a specific character as delimiter. FIXME: This method is also specified in the CategoricalValueFinder class.
        Parameters:
        id - Identifier of this collection of keywords.
        keywords - A string containing keywords.
        tokDelimiter - The delimiter character between keywords.
        Returns:
        A set of tokens (keywords).

      • tokenize

        public TokenSet tokenize(String id,
                         String value,
                         int qgram)
        Tokenizes the given string value using qgrams.
        Parameters:
        id - Identifier of this collection of tokens.
        value - A string value.
        qgram - The qgram used (if applicable for string similarity).
        Returns:
        A set of tokens derived from the original string.

      • createZeroPoint

        public Point createZeroPoint(int d)
        Creates a d-dimensional point with zero values in all coordinates
        Parameters:
        d - The dimensionality of the point.
        Returns:
        A d-dimensional point with zero values in all coordinates.

      • createNaNPoint

        public Point createNaNPoint(int d)
        Creates a d-dimensional point with NaN values in all coordinates
        Parameters:
        d - The dimensionality of the point.
        Returns:
        A d-dimensional point with NaN values in all coordinates.

      • applyOnDoubleArrays

        public double[] applyOnDoubleArrays(DoubleBinaryOperator operator,
                                    double[] a,
                                    double[] b)
        Applies a given operation (e.g., SUM) over two input arrays of double numbers value per value.
        Parameters:
        operator - The operator to apply over the two arrays element-wise.
        a - The first array of double values.
        b - The first array of double values.
        Returns:
        The resulting array of double values.

      • applyOnDoubleArray

        public double[] applyOnDoubleArray(DoubleUnaryOperator operator,
                                   double[] a)
        Applies a given operation (e.g., division by a number) over each value of an input array of double numbers.
        Parameters:
        operator - The operator to apply over the elements of this array.
        a - The input array of double values.
        Returns:
        The resulting array of double values.

      • isNumeric

        public boolean isNumeric(String str)
        Checks whether the given string value represents a valid number.
        Parameters:
        str - The string value to check.
        Returns:
        True, if the string represents a valid number; otherwise, False.

      • isDateTime

        public boolean isDateTime(String str)
        Checks whether the given string value represents a valid date/time.
        Parameters:
        str - The string value to check.
        Returns:
        True, if the string represents a valid date/time; otherwise, False.

      • isYear

        public boolean isYear(String str)
        Checks whether the given string value represents a valid year.
        Parameters:
        str - The string value to check.
        Returns:
        True, if the string represents a valid year; otherwise, False.

      • getEpoch

        public Double getEpoch(String str)
        Parses the given string to extract a date/time value.
        Parameters:
        str - A string containing a date/time value.
        Returns:
        A double number representing the equivalent UNIX epoch (milliseconds in the decimal part).

      • pickRandomValue

        public Object pickRandomValue(Map<String,?> targetData,
                              DataType.Type dtype)
        Randomly pick a value from a dataset of (key, value) pairs.
        Parameters:
        targetData - The dataset, typically retaining attribute values.
        dtype - The data type of the values.
        Returns:
        A randomly chosen value from the dataset.
